revised_title: A Study of Resonance Radiation in Sodium Spectra
tldr: The author studied the line spectrum of sodium as excited by fluorescence and discovered the phenomenon of resonance radiation. They found that the efficiency of observing resonance radiation depends on the narrowness of the spectral lines and the use of a sodium vacuum arc in quartz as a light source. The author also discussed the challenges and improvements in the construction of the sodium lamp and the capricious nature of resonance radiation.
